title: China Sees Hints of a Past Threat: Inflation
summary: If it persists, a steady uptick in prices could complicate Beijing’s effort to support economic growth and contend with the trade war with the United States.

title: Trump Hit Iran With Oil Sanctions. So Far, They’re Working.
summary: Iranian exports have fallen without a feared surge in global prices, thanks to plentiful supplies. Still, the policy’s success could be fleeting.

summary: The Jet Airways blunder is just the latest sign of trouble in the country’s airline industry.

summary: President Trump has been pressuring the oil producers to pump more and hold down prices. But the Saudis and their allies say customers have adequate supplies.

title: G.E. Ousts Chief Just Over a Year After Picking Him to Lead a Turnaround
summary: General Electric, in announcing the replacement of John Flannery, said it was facing “weaker performance” in its power generator business.

title: Passengers Are Stranded as Another European Airline Collapses
summary: Primera Air’s efforts to expand couldn’t overcome a competitive market and rising fuel costs. Its abrupt end meant canceled flights in North America and Europe.

title: On Wall Street, the Bond Market Sets the Tone
summary: The rise in yields is a double-edged sword. It reflects optimism about the economy, but also gives traders reasons to worry.

summary: The giant global oil companies’ cash flow has grown 10-fold in four years, but they are cautious, even anxious, about the future.

summary: No end is in sight in the fight over control of the oil-rich semiautonomous region of Iraq.

summary: An agreement on the Caspian Sea’s status resolves one problem in an oil region with many of them.

summary: Barbados turns out only 1,000 barrels a day, while France produces 16,418.

title: 2018 Nobel in Economics Is Awarded to William Nordhaus and Paul Romer
summary: Mr. Nordhaus was recognized for pioneering the economics of climate change, and Mr. Romer for explaining the role of ideas in fostering growth.

summary: The attack punctuated a week of deadly violence in the capital and struck at the core of the country’s deteriorating economy.

summary: Leaders from around the world have gathered in New York to deal with a host of nettlesome issues, ranging from Iran’s nuclear program to North Korea to wars in the Middle East.

summary: The New Zealand prime minister’s values, charisma and status as a new mother have made her a superstar. But critics say there is much more to leadership.

summary: Since President Trump announced that he would pull out of the Iran nuclear deal, European leaders are actively working to help Tehran get around new sanctions.

title: Duterte’s Luster Dulls as Rice Prices Soar in Philippines
summary: The president ordered restrictions on rice imports to be dropped in an effort to tame inflation, but his administration has been widely blamed for mismanaging the issue.
